reviews.review_msg: Classes are boring. Wouldnt take his class again.

Marek is a legend! Promotes students to Eagles of different classes, for example, there is a First Major Eagle (gets purple heart award). In all seriousness Marek is a legend with legendary quotes such as, "when you see a complicated circuit, don't panic on the titanic" and "my duty is to provide an error rich environment". Take the class with him!
I have trouble with his accent. Notes are very random, hard to follow. Buy text book, or you wont pass

Marek is a beauty. Great guy.  Always willing to help, very fair in terms of his expectations for quizzes. Doesn't ask questions about the things that seem extremely difficult from the lectures. Labs are quite challenging but rewarding.

Go to class and pass. Labs can be hard but that's microelectronics.   Teaching 325 he can clearly explain the topics better than 225 now that the students are more senior. He clearly knows what he's talking about and he also had 5 quizzes worth 10% each which helped split up exam marks fairly. His bad rep on this site I don't think is earned fairly
Really nice Prof. U have to be aware that the class itself is hard and heavy load. No quiz No midterm. If u put hard work into  ur lab, u r good to go! Good luck!

It's easy to get a good mark in this course with Marek, as labs and assignments are worth 70%. However, that doesn't mean that this course is easy... there's a lot of lab work, so be prepared for that. If you put work into the labs and assignments, you can easily get ~100% on those parts, so that getting 50% on the final still nets you an A.

Marek is a good guy. Marks extremely easily, if you get a bad grade in his class you are doing something really wrong. Final is worth very little of your grade and is open book. Treats students well. Beware, the course is heavy loaded though, and he has a bad habbit of using notes from books other than the class book.

Marek is really nice guy but the thing about ENSC 325 is the course is extremely heavy loaded. He scales a lot. It's unbelievable .you don't have midterm exam nor quizzes but he gives you True and False questions in the final exam which sounds strange for this course but at the end you will be happy with  your the marks that you get.

Fairly good teaching skills. Has a soft voice with a Polish accent, so it's kinda hard to understand him. Doesn't give much homework. Labs were very hard to do and grading for them was kinda unfair. This course has a LOT of material, but the final was easy. Overall, not a very hard course. Average was around 70% for our class.
Poor teaching skills, avoid at all cost.  8/32 student dropped the course due to him.
Believes in multiple choice, read his notes very carefully, bit confusing in lec
Simply THE BEST PROF you can ever have for a hard and annoying course. She makes everything so easy to understand!
I dont normally rate profs on this site, but she deserves a good rating. I recommend taking every course you can with her

She is definitely one of the best professors at SFU. Very approachable and will go out of her way to help students. Assignments might seem long, but are the most helpful resources (she likes picking questions from assignments and quizzes for midterms)!
She's awesome. Great teaching style and attitude. Really approachable, helpful, and very easy on the eyes.

The amount of enthusiasm she shows is contagious amongst students.Attending her class makes you want to learn in such an important course. Always available to help students.                    (with that nice attitude its really hard to miss her lectures, even at 8.30am in the morning :))
BEST PROFESSOR!!! I really like her attitude towards students. doesn't have Professor kinda attitude at all and so, every student will absolutely love the way she teaches and interact.
She is really nice. Exams are easy. she wants you to get a good mark!
Homa is a really nice professor. Very enthusiastic about what she's teaching.
NOTHING IS DIFFICULT!
he was OK..

He is the best prof at SFU. I dont know what this guy talks about, well he covered the theory and then solved as many questions as was needed. He is 10 times better than Ash or whoever I have taken courses with. The text book was great (100 times better than Sedra). Overall Nima was the greatest prof that I have had at SFU.
Best prof I ever had
Excellent professor. I'm sure he will be a very well known and important person in future of his life.
Awesome prof.
He is one the best profs at SFU. His lectures were well prepared, and to the point. Nima always had a very nice attitude.

I found his lectures were very unorganized.  All he did was solve example after example with no theory or explanation behind it.  The text book was almost as bad, with only very specific examples and no solved problems.  The tutorials were also a waste of time.  His only strength was his easy going attitude.

The best 325 prof we have.  Nima took out all the crap that you'd never calculate by hand and focused on building intuition for 'first-order' analysis... Transistor behavior was my weakest area in 225.  After 325 with Nima, I can now figure out impedances/gains of most single/multi-stage transistor amps by inspection.

Nima is one of the best teacher/professor I have had in my whole life. He spends an insane amount of time preparing for his lectures, labs, assignments, quizes, etc. And I have learned SO MUCH from him. I have never seen a prof more dedicated to teaching. But be prepared, his course work load is very heavy! I'll update when final grade is out.
